00003 #include "sage3basic.h"

00006 void
00007 SgAsmElfSection::ctor()
00008 {
00009     set_synthesized(false);
00010     set_purpose(SP_UNSPECIFIED);
00011 }
00012 
00017 SgAsmElfSection *
00018 SgAsmElfSection::init_from_section_table(SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *shdr, SgAsmElfStringSection *strsec, int id)
00019 {
00020     ROSE_ASSERT(shdr);
00021     ROSE_ASSERT(strsec);
00022     ROSE_ASSERT(id>=0);
00023 
00024     /* Purpose */
00025     switch (shdr->get_sh_type()) {
00026       case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_PROGBITS:
00027         set_purpose(SP_PROGRAM);
00028         break;
00029       case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_STRTAB:
00030         set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00031         break;
00032       case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_DYNSYM:
00033       case SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_SYMTAB:
00034         set_purpose(SP_SYMTAB);
00035         break;
00036       default:
00037         set_purpose(SP_OTHER);
00038         break;
00039     }
00040 
00041     /* File mapping */
00042     set_offset(shdr->get_sh_offset());
00043     if (SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_NULL==shdr->get_sh_type() ||
00044         SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry::SHT_NOBITS==shdr->get_sh_type()) {
00045         set_size(0);
00046     } else {
00047         set_size(shdr->get_sh_size());
00048     }
00049     set_file_alignment(shdr->get_sh_addralign());
00050     grab_content();
00051 
00052     /* Memory mapping */
00053     if (shdr->get_sh_addr() > 0) {
00054         set_mapped_preferred_rva(shdr->get_sh_addr());
00055         set_mapped_actual_va(0); /*will be assigned by Loader*/
00056         set_mapped_size(shdr->get_sh_size());
00057         set_mapped_rperm(true);
00058         set_mapped_wperm((shdr->get_sh_flags() & 0x01) == 0x01);
00059         set_mapped_xperm((shdr->get_sh_flags() & 0x04) == 0x04);
00060         set_mapped_alignment(shdr->get_sh_addralign());
00061     } else {
00062         set_mapped_preferred_rva(0);
00063         set_mapped_actual_va(0); /*will be assigned by Loader*/
00064         set_mapped_size(0);
00065         set_mapped_rperm(false);
00066         set_mapped_wperm(false);
00067         set_mapped_xperm(false);
00068         set_mapped_alignment(shdr->get_sh_addralign());
00069     }
00070 
00071     /* Name. This has to be near the end because possibly strsec==this, in which case we have to call set_size() to extend the
00072      * section to be large enough before we can try to look up the name. */
00073     set_id(id);
00074     set_name(new SgAsmStoredString(strsec->get_strtab(), shdr->get_sh_name()));
00075 
00076     /* Add section table entry to section */
00077     set_section_entry(shdr);
00078     shdr->set_parent(this);
00079 
00080     return this;
00081 }

00084 SgAsmElfSection *
00085 SgAsmElfSection::init_from_segment_table(SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry *shdr, bool mmap_only)
00086 {
00087     if (!mmap_only) {
00088         /* Purpose */
00089         set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00090 
00091         /* File mapping */
00092         set_offset(shdr->get_offset());
00093         set_size(shdr->get_filesz());
00094         set_file_alignment(shdr->get_align());
00095         grab_content();
00096     
00097         /* Name */
00098         char name[128];
00099         switch (shdr->get_type()) {
00100             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_LOAD:         strcpy(name, "LOAD");        break;
00101             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_DYNAMIC:      strcpy(name, "DYNAMIC");     break;
00102             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_INTERP:       strcpy(name, "INTERP");      break;
00103             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_NOTE:         strcpy(name, "NOTE");        break;
00104             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_SHLIB:        strcpy(name, "SHLIB");       break;
00105             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_PHDR:         strcpy(name, "PHDR");        break;
00106             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_TLS:          strcpy(name, "TLS");         break;
00107             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_GNU_EH_FRAME: strcpy(name, "EH_FRAME");    break;
00108             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_GNU_STACK:    strcpy(name, "GNU_STACK");   break;
00109             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_GNU_RELRO:    strcpy(name, "GNU_RELRO");   break;
00110             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_PAX_FLAGS:    strcpy(name, "PAX_FLAGS");   break;
00111             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_SUNWBSS:      strcpy(name, "SUNWBSS");     break;
00112             case SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PT_SUNWSTACK:    strcpy(name, "SUNWSTACK");   break;
00113             default:                                         sprintf(name, "PT_0x%08x", shdr->get_type()); break;
00114         }
00115         sprintf(name+strlen(name), "#%zu", shdr->get_index());
00116         set_name(new SgAsmBasicString(name));
00117     }
00118     
00119     /* Memory mapping */
00120     set_mapped_preferred_rva(shdr->get_vaddr());
00121     set_mapped_actual_va(0); /*will be assigned by Loader*/
00122     set_mapped_size(shdr->get_memsz());
00123     set_mapped_alignment(shdr->get_align());
00124     set_mapped_rperm(shdr->get_flags() & SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PF_RPERM ? true : false);
00125     set_mapped_wperm(shdr->get_flags() & SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PF_WPERM ? true : false);
00126     set_mapped_xperm(shdr->get_flags() & SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry::PF_XPERM ? true : false);
00127 
00128     /* Add segment table entry to section */
00129     set_segment_entry(shdr);
00130     shdr->set_parent(this);
00131 
00132     return this;
00133 }

00137 SgAsmElfSection::get_elf_header() const
00138 {
00139     return dynamic_cast<SgAsmElfFileHeader*>(get_header());

00160 rose_addr_t
00161 SgAsmElfSection::calculate_sizes(size_t r32size, size_t r64size,       /*size of required parts*/
00162                                  const std::vector<size_t> &optsizes,  /*size of optional parts and number of parts parsed*/
00163                                  size_t *entsize, size_t *required, size_t *optional, size_t *entcount) const
00164 {
00165     size_t struct_size = 0;
00166     size_t extra_size = 0;
00167     size_t entry_size = 0;
00168     size_t nentries = 0;
00169     SgAsmElfFileHeader *fhdr = get_elf_header();
00170 
00171     /* Assume ELF Section Table Entry is correct for now for the size of each entry in the table. */
00172     ROSE_ASSERT(get_section_entry()!=NULL);
00173     entry_size = get_section_entry()->get_sh_entsize();
00174 
00175     /* Size of required part of each entry */
00176     if (0==r32size && 0==r64size) {
00177         /* Probably called by four-argument SgAsmElfSection::calculate_sizes and we don't know the sizes of the required parts
00178          * because there isn't a parser for this type of section, or the section doesn't contain a table. In the latter case
00179          * the ELF Section Table has a zero sh_entsize and we'll treat the section as if it were a table with one huge entry.
00180          * Otherwise we'll assume that the struct size is the same as the sh_entsize and there's no optional data. */
00181         struct_size = entry_size>0 ? entry_size : get_size();
00182     } else if (4==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00183         struct_size = r32size;
00184     } else if (8==fhdr->get_word_size()) {
00185         struct_size = r64size;
00186     } else {
00187         throw FormatError("bad ELF word size");
00188     }
00189 
00190     /* Entire entry should be at least large enough for the required part. This also takes care of the case when the ELF
00191      * Section Table Entry has a zero-valued sh_entsize */
00192     entry_size = std::max(entry_size, struct_size);
00193 
00194     /* Size of optional parts. If we've parsed the table then use the largest optional part, otherwise assume the entry from
00195      * the ELF Section Table is correct. */
00196     nentries = optsizes.size();
00197     if (nentries>0) {
00198         for (size_t i=0; i<nentries; i++) {
00199             extra_size = std::max(extra_size, optsizes[i]);
00200         }
00201         entry_size = std::min(entry_size, struct_size+extra_size);
00202     } else {
00203         extra_size = entry_size - struct_size;
00204         nentries = entry_size>0 ? get_size() / entry_size : 0;
00205     }
00206 
00207     /* Return values */
00208     if (entsize)
00209         *entsize = entry_size;
00210     if (required)
00211         *required = struct_size;
00212     if (optional)
00213         *optional = extra_size;
00214     if (entcount)
00215         *entcount = nentries;
00216     return entry_size * nentries;
00217 }
00218 
00227 rose_addr_t
00228 SgAsmElfSection::calculate_sizes(size_t *entsize, size_t *required, size_t *optional, size_t *entcount) const
00229 {
00230     return calculate_sizes(0, 0, std::vector<size_t>(), entsize, required, optional, entcount);
00231 }
00232 
00234 bool
00235 SgAsmElfSection::reallocate()
00236 {
00237     bool reallocated = false;
00238     SgAsmElfSectionTableEntry *sechdr = get_section_entry();
00239     SgAsmElfSegmentTableEntry *seghdr = get_segment_entry();
00240 
00241     /* Change section size if this section was defined in the ELF Section Table */
00242     if (sechdr!=NULL) {
00243         rose_addr_t need = calculate_sizes(NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00244         if (need < get_size()) {
00245             if (is_mapped()) {
00246                 ROSE_ASSERT(get_mapped_size()==get_size());
00247                 set_mapped_size(need);
00248             }
00249             set_size(need);
00250             reallocated = true;
00251         } else if (need > get_size()) {
00252             get_file()->shift_extend(this, 0, need-get_size(), SgAsmGenericFile::ADDRSP_ALL, SgAsmGenericFile::ELASTIC_HOLE);
00253             reallocated = true;
00254         }
00255     }
00256 
00257     /* Update entry in the ELF Section Table and/or ELF Segment Table */
00258     if (sechdr)
00259         sechdr->update_from_section(this);
00260     if (seghdr)
00261         seghdr->update_from_section(this);
00262     
00263     return reallocated;
00264 }
00265 
00267 void
00268 SgAsmElfSection::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00269 {
00270     char p[4096];
00271     if (idx>=0) {
00272         sprintf(p, "%sElfSection[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00273     } else {
00274         sprintf(p, "%sElfSection.", prefix);
00275     }
00276     int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00277     
00278     SgAsmGenericSection::dump(f, p, -1);
00279     
00280     if (get_section_entry())
00281         get_section_entry()->dump(f, p, -1);
00282     if (get_segment_entry())
00283         get_segment_entry()->dump(f, p, -1);
00284 
00285     if (p_linked_section) {
00286         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%d] \"%s\"\n", p, w, "linked_to",
00287                 p_linked_section->get_id(), p_linked_section->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00288     } else {
00289         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = NULL\n",    p, w, "linked_to");
00290     }
00291 
00292     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmElfSection) //unless a base class
00293         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00294 }
